headline: Ethiopia's military calls on former members to rejoin army as rebels advance on capital
author: David McKenzie, CNN
contributors: CNN's Eliza Mackintosh and Kara Fox contributed to this report.
intro: Ethiopia's military is calling on veterans to rejoin the army as two aligned rebel groups threaten the capital, marking the latest sign the government is marshaling its power to defend Addis Ababa.

headline: Armed groups join forces in Ethiopia in biggest threat yet to embattled Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed
author: Eliza Mackintosh, CNN
contributors: CNN's David McKenzie and Jennifer Hansler contributed to this report.
intro: Armed groups fighting Ethiopia's central government are swelling in numbers as they advance on the capital, Addis Ababa, posing the biggest threat to embattled Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed's rule since a bloody year-long conflict began in the country's northern Tigray region a year ago.

headline: State Department establishes task force on Ethiopia as conflict rages
author: Jennifer Hansler, CNN
intro: The State Department has established a new task force to oversee its "planning, management and logistics related to events in Ethiopia," a spokesperson confirmed Friday.

headline: Ethiopia is at war with itself. Here's what you need to know about the conflict
author: Eliza Mackintosh, CNN
contributors: CNN's Bethlehem Feleke in Nairobi and Jennifer Hansler in Washington, DC, contributed to this report.
intro: When Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed received the Nobel Peace Prize in 2019, he was lauded as a regional peacemaker. Now, he is presiding over a protracted civil war that by many accounts bears the hallmarks of genocide.

headline: From Nobel laureate to global pariah: How the world got Abiy Ahmed and Ethiopia so wrong
author: Eliza Mackintosh, CNN
contributors: This story has been updated to correct the spelling of William Davison's name. A quote from Mehari Taddele Maru has been updated for clarity.
intro: "Abiy, Abiy," the crowd chanted, waving Ethiopia's tricolor flag and cheering as the country's new prime minister, dressed in a white blazer with gold trim and smiling broadly, waved to a packed basketball arena at the University of Southern California in Los Angeles, part of a whirlwind three-city tour of the United States to woo the diaspora.

headline: Rebels threaten Ethiopian capital as UN slams atrocities committed in Tigray conflict
author: Eliza Mackintosh, CNN
contributors: Eliza Mackintosh wrote and reported from London. CNN's Nima Elbagir, Stephanie Halasz, Sharon Braithwaite and Schams Elwazer in London, Richard Roth in New York and Jennifer Hansler in Washington, DC, contributed to this report.
intro: Troops allied against Ethiopia's central government are on the outskirts of Addis Ababa, a diplomatic source told CNN Wednesday, a day after authorities announced a nationwide state of emergency and called on citizens to take up arms to defend the capital.

headline: Ethiopia announces state of emergency as Tigrayan forces gain ground
author: Bethlehem Feleke, CNN, and Reuters
intro: Ethiopia's Attorney General Gedion Timothewos announced a state of emergency starting Tuesday, after forces from the northern Tigray region said they had gained territory.

headline: Ethiopia on verge of losing access to lucrative US trade program over human rights violations
author: Jennifer Hansler, CNN
contributors: CNN's Nicole Gaouette, Bethlehem Feleke, and Nima Elbagir contributed to this report.
intro: Ethiopia will lose access to a lucrative US trade program due to human rights violations unless it takes significant steps toward ending the ongoing conflict and alleviating the humanitarian crisis by the start of 2022, senior administration officials said Tuesday.

headline: Ethiopia says Tigray forces killed 100 youths in key town; TPLF denies claim
author: Story by Reuters
intro: The Ethiopian government accused rebellious Tigrayan forces on Monday of killing 100 youths in the town of Kombolcha, as the United States expressed concern about Tigrayan advances a year into the fighting.

headline: Mekelle struck, residents flee Amhara as Ethiopia battle intensifies
author: Story by Reuters and Bethlehem Feleke, CNN
intro: The Ethiopian government launched an airstrike Friday on the capital of the northern Tigray region, and residents in a city in the neighboring Amhara region said people there were taking flight from intensifying fighting.

headline: Fresh airstrikes hit capital of Ethiopia's war-torn Tigray region
author: Bethlehem Feleke, Katie Polglase and Gianluca Mezzofiore, CNN
contributors: Bethlehem Feleke reported from Nairobi, Katie Polglase and Gianluca Mezzofiore reported from London. Sheena McKenzie wrote in London. Lindsay Isaac contributed to this report
intro: The capital of Ethiopia's war-torn Tigray region was covered in smoke on Wednesday as the city was hit by another day of airstrikes, eyewitnesses and authorities told CNN.

headline: Three children killed in airstrikes on Ethiopia's Tigray region, UN says
author: Gianluca Mezzofiore, Bethlehem Feleke, Barbara Arvanitidis and Sharon Braithwaite, CNN
contributors: CNN's Kara Fox and Eliza Mackintosh contributed reporting.
intro: Three children were killed and one person was injured in Monday's airstrikes in Mekelle, the capital of Ethiopia's war-torn Tigray region, the United Nations said Tuesday.

headline: Capital of Ethiopia's Tigray region hit by airstrikes, eyewitness and local forces say
author: Bethlehem Feleke, Barbara Arvanitidis and Gianluca Mezzofiore, CNN
intro: The capital of Ethiopia's war-torn Tigray region was hit by at least two airstrikes on Monday, an eyewitness and a spokesman for forces fighting the country's central government told CNN.

headline: Ethiopia used its flagship commercial airline to transport weapons during war in Tigray
author:
Exclusive by Nima Elbagir, Gianluca Mezzofiore, Katie Polglase and Barbara Arvanitidis, CNN
Video by Mark Baron, CNN
intro: Ethiopia's government has used the country's flagship commercial airline to shuttle weapons to and from neighboring Eritrea during the civil war in Ethiopia's Tigray region, a CNN investigation has found.

headline: US warns it could sanction Ethiopia after CNN reveals airline ferried weapons during Tigray war
author: Nima Elbagir, Gianluca Mezzofiore, Katie Polglase and Eliza Mackintosh, CNN
contributors: CNN's Barbara Arvanitidis contributed to this report.
intro: The Biden administration has described a CNN report that Ethiopian Airlines shuttled weapons to Eritrea as "incredibly grave" and warned that it was prepared to impose sanctions on Ethiopia and any other parties who prolonged the conflict in Tigray.

headline: Ethiopian parliament confirms Abiy Ahmed as prime minister
author: Story by Reuters
intro: Ethiopia's parliament confirmed incumbent Abiy Ahmed as prime minister for a five-year term on Monday, cementing his power domestically amid mounting international concern over his government's handling of the conflict in northern Ethiopia.

headline: UN Secretary-General rebuffs Ethiopia's demand for senior UN officials to leave the country
author: Eliza Mackintosh and Richard Roth, CNN
contributors: CNN's Bethlehem Feleke in Nairobi and Caitlin Hu in New York contributed reporting.
intro: The United Nations has rebuffed Ethiopia's decision to expel seven senior UN officials as the country's war-torn northern Tigray region descends into famine, UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said on Friday.

headline: Ethiopia to expel UN officials amid fears of Tigray famine
author: Bethlehem Feleke and Eliza Mackintosh, CNN
contributors: CNN's Caitlin Hu contributed reporting from New York.
intro: Ethiopia is expelling seven senior United Nations officials, just days after the UN's aid chief warned the war-torn northern Tigray region was descending into famine due to the government's blockade of aid deliveries.

headline: Where is the outrage for Ethiopia?
author: Opinion by Isha Sesay, Masai Ujiri, Gbenga Akinnagbe and Liz Agbor-Tabi
intro: The sudden fall of Afghanistan to the Taliban has rightly drawn much of the world's ire and attention. Fears of women's rights and civil liberties being swept aside by Islamic extremism, along with trepidation about the country's threat to regional stability, have all justly triggered global concern.

headline: Biden signs executive order authorizing new Ethiopia sanctions amid reports of atrocities
author: Jennifer Hansler, Nima Elbagir and Betsy Klein, CNN
intro: President Joe Biden signed a new executive order Friday authorizing broad sanctions against those involved in perpetrating the ongoing conflict in Ethiopia as reports of atrocities continue to emerge from the Tigray region.

headline: Men are marched out of prison camps. Then corpses float down the river
author:
Nima Elbagir, Katie Polglase, Barbara Arvanitidis, Gianluca Mezzofiore, Laura Smith-Spark
Video by Alex Platt and Mark Baron
contributors:
This story has been updated with the latest findings from forensic experts in Sudan.
Jennifer Hansler contributed to this report.
intro: The ghostly outlines of limbs emerge through the mist along the Setit River in eastern Sudan. As the river's path narrows, the drifting bodies become wedged on the silty clay bank and their forms appear more clearly; men, women, teenagers and even children.

headline: Sexual violence against women and girls in Ethiopia's Tigray region amount to war crimes, Amnesty says
author: Nima Elbagir and Lauren Kent, CNN
intro: Troops and militias aligned with the Ethiopian government have subjected hundreds of women and girls to sexual violence in Ethiopia's war-torn Tigray region, according to a new report by Amnesty International.

headline: Tigrayan fighters reportedly seize control of UN World Heritage Site in Ethiopia
author: Richard Roth, Michael Conte and Sarah Dean, CNN
contributors: CNN's Bethlehem Feleke and Larry Madowo in Nairobi contributed reporting.
intro: Fighters from Ethiopia's war-torn Tigray region have seized control of a UN World Heritage Site in a neighboring region, Reuters and AFP reported, citing eyewitnesses.

headline: At least 30 bodies float down river between Ethiopia's Tigray and Sudan
author: Story by Reuters
intro: At least 30 corpses have washed up on the Sudanese banks of a river that abuts Ethiopia's northern region of Tigray, according to two Ethiopian refugees and four Sudanese witnesses who told Reuters on Monday they had retrieved the bodies.

headline: UN says food aid in Ethiopia's war-torn Tigray region will run out Friday as 400,000 people face famine
author: Rob Picheta, James Briggs and Larry Madowo, CNN
intro: The UN World Food Programme said it expected to run out of food in the war-torn Ethiopian region of Tigray on Friday, and that hundreds of thousands of people in the area were on the brink of famine.

headline: Ethiopia's Tigray forces enter neighboring Afar region, Afar says
author: Story by Reuters
intro: Forces from Ethiopia's northern Tigray region have mounted attacks in neighboring Afar region, a spokesman for Afar said on Monday, marking an expansion of an eight-month-old conflict into a previously untouched area.

headline: Food and fuel running out in capital of Ethiopia's war-torn Tigray region
author: Nima Elbagir and Richard Roth, CNN
contributors: Additional reporting by CNN's producer on the ground in Mekelle, Ethiopia, whom we are not naming for their safety. Nima Elbagir reported from London. Richard Roth reported from New York. Sarah Dean wrote in London.
intro: Food and fuel is running out in the capital of Ethiopia's war-torn northern Tigray region, a CNN producer on the ground in Mekelle reports.

headline: Ethiopia is at war with itself. Here's what you need to know about the conflict
author: Eliza Mackintosh, CNN
contributors: CNN's Bethlehem Feleke in Nairobi and Jennifer Hansler in Washington, DC, contributed to this report.
intro: When Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed received the Nobel Peace Prize in 2019, he was lauded as a regional peacemaker. Now, he is presiding over a protracted civil war that by many accounts bears the hallmarks of genocide.

headline: Rebels in Tigray reject calls for ceasefire after Ethiopian government forces withdraw from regional capital
author: Eliza Mackintosh, Bethlehem Feleke and Vasco Cotovio, CNN
contributors: CNN's Eliza Mackintosh and Vasco Cotovio wrote and reported from London. Bethlehem Fekele reported from Nairobi. CNN's Nima Elbagir, Katie Polglase and Gianluca Mezzofiore contributed to this report.
intro: Rebel forces in the war-torn Ethiopian region of Tigray have rejected a ceasefire offer from the central government, raising fears of further violence a day after the fighters retook the regional capital Mekelle.

headline: Ethiopia's government announce ceasefire as Tigrayan troops retake region's capital
author: Bethlehem Feleke, Richard Roth, Kristina Sgueglia, Vasco Cotovio, Nima Elbagir and CNN Staff
contributors: CNN's Bethlehem Feleke reported from Nairobi, and Richard Roth and Kristina Sgueglia from New York City.
intro: In a stunning about-turn in the devastating eight-month civil war in Ethiopia's northern Tigray region, the Ethiopian government declared an immediate and unilateral ceasefire after Tigrayan troops retook the regional capital Mekelle on Monday evening.

headline: New video of Ethiopia massacre shows soldiers passing phone around to document their executions of unarmed men
author: Gianluca Mezzofiore, Katie Polglase, Nima Elbagir and Barbara Arvanitidis, CNN
contributors: CNN's Oscar Featherstone contributed to this report. An Ethiopian journalist contributed reporting to this story but cannot be named for their safety.
intro: A few scattered human bones lay on the rocky ground, along with a broken skull and several half-burned identification cards.

headline: Condemnation builds over deadly government airstrike in Tigray
author: Bethlehem Feleke and Eliza Mackintosh, CNN
intro: International condemnation is growing over an airstrike that killed dozens of people in Ethiopia's war-torn northern Tigray region earlier this week, as Africa's second-most populous nation tallied ballots to decide its next leader.

headline: Voting underway in Ethiopia amid conflict and a raging humanitarian crisis
author: Nimi Princewill and Bethlehem Feleke, CNN
contributors: Nimi Princewill wrote from Abuja, Nigeria and Bethlehem Feleke reported from Addis Ababa, Ethiopia. Stephanie Busari contributed to this report.
intro: ns headed to the polls Monday for a controversial election being carried out amid an ongoing conflict and a raging humanitarian crisis in the country's northern Tigray region.

headline: 'There is famine in Ethiopia right now,' says UN aid chief
author: Eleanor Pickston and Nima Elbagir, CNN
intro: Over 350,000 people in Ethiopia's conflict-ravaged Tigray region are experiencing dire hunger, finds a new report by the United Nations and other aid groups.

headline: Ethiopian government defends actions in Tigray Region, accuses critics of 'orchestrated attack'
author: Emmet Lyons, Arnaud Siad and Ivana Kottasová, CNN
intro: The Government of Ethiopia has defended its actions in the northern province of Tigray, saying that it "condemns all acts that put the life and dignity of civilians in danger."

headline: Hundreds of detained Tigrayans released following CNN report
author: Nima Elbagir, Barbara Arvanitidis, Katie Polglase and Gianluca Mezzofiore, CNN
contributors: This story follows on from an investigation by Nima Elbagir, Barbara Arvanitidis, Katie Polglase, Gianluca Mezzofiore, Bethlehem Feleke and Eliza Mackintosh. CNN's Jennifer Hansler, Angela Dewan and Kara Fox contributed to this report.
intro: Hundreds of men in Ethiopia's restive region of Tigray were released on Thursday evening, eyewitnesses and aid workers said, following a CNN report into their detention that prompted international outcry.

headline: Tigrayans told, 'We'll see if America will save you now,' as hundreds rounded up by Ethiopian and Eritrean soldiers
author: Nima Elbagir, Barbara Arvanitidis, Gianluca Mezzofiore and Katie Polglase, CNN
contributors: Reporting contributed by DJ Judd.
intro: Days after the United States announced financial sanctions and visa restrictions on Ethiopian and Eritrean officials, eyewitnesses told CNN that hundreds of young men were rounded up from displaced peoples camps in Shire, a town in Tigray, late Monday evening.

headline: The Nobel Peace Prize winner who's presiding over a humanitarian catastrophe
author: Opinion by Michelle Gulino and Malaak Jamal
intro: In 2018, after a two-year conflict, two historically warring nations — Ethiopia and Eritrea — at last signed a peace agreement. The following year, Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed, who brokered the peace, was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize.

headline: US Senate passes unanimous resolution calling for withdrawal of Eritrean forces from Ethiopia
author: Nima Elbagir and Eliza Mackintosh, CNN
intro: The US Senate has unanimously passed a resolution calling for the immediate withdrawal of Eritrean troops from Ethiopia's war-torn northern Tigray region, after a CNN investigation revealed that the soldiers were cutting off critical aid routes.

headline: US condemns 'atrocities' in Tigray and calls for those responsible to be 'held to account' after CNN investigation
author: Nima Elbagir and Nicky Robertson, CNN
contributors: CNN's Jennifer Hansler, Veronica Stracqualursi, Barbara Arvanitidis, Eliza Mackintosh and Rachel Janfaza contributed to this report.
intro: The US has condemned Eritrea and Ethiopia for coordinating their troops to close off a key aid route to Ethiopia's war-torn Tigray region, following an exclusive CNN investigation published earlier this week that found that Eritrean soldiers were blocking critical humanitarian aid to starving and wounded civilians.

headline: Top House Foreign Affairs member calls for sanctions in Tigray after CNN report shows military forces blocking aid
author: Veronica Stracqualursi and Nima Elbagir, CNN
contributors: CNN's Jennifer Hansler, Nima Elbagir, Barbara Arvanitidis and Eliza Mackintosh contributed to this report.
intro: The top Republican on the House Foreign Affairs Committee is calling on the Biden administration to enact sanctions in response to the ongoing human rights abuses in the Tigray region of Ethiopia after a CNN investigation found that Eritrean soldiers were blocking critical humanitarian aid to starving and wounded civilians.

headline: Eritrean troops disguised as Ethiopian military are blocking critical aid in Tigray
author:
Nima Elbagir, Barbara Arvanitidis and Eliza Mackintosh
Video by Alex Platt and Mark Baron, CNN
contributors:
Nima Elbagir and Barbara Arvanitidis reported from Axum. Eliza Mackintosh wrote and reported from London. CNN's Richard Roth in New York and Jennifer Hansler in Washington, DC, also contributed to this report.

Design and visual editing by Natalie Croker, Sarah Tilotta and Muhammad Darwish.

headline: UN confirms military forces blocking aid in Ethiopia's Tigray region following CNN investigation
author: Eliza Mackintosh and Richard Roth, CNN
contributors: Eliza Mackintosh wrote from London and Richard Roth reported from the United Nations in New York. Jennifer Hansler, Nima Elbagir, Barbara Arvanitidis and Alex Platt contributed to this report.
intro: The United Nations has confirmed that military forces are impeding humanitarian access to parts of Ethiopia's war-torn Tigray region, after an exclusive CNN investigation revealed that Eritrean troops were coordinating with Ethiopian forces to cut off critical aid routes.

headline: Ethiopian Orthodox Church Patriarch condemns Tigray 'genocide'
author: Duarte Mendonca and Nima Elbagir, CNN
intro: The head of the Ethiopian Orthodox Tewahedo Church has condemned his own country's rulers in a video recorded by the director of a US-based charity, saying "they want to destroy the people of Tigray" with actions of "the highest brutality and cruelty."

headline: UN breaks silence on Ethiopia crisis, urges investigation into reported Tigray atrocities
author: Richard Roth, Bethlehem Feleke and Laura Smith-Spark, CNN
contributors: CNN's Richard Roth reported from New York and Bethlehem Feleke from Nairobi, while Laura Smith-Spark wrote from London.
intro: The United Nations Security Council has voiced "deep concern" over a humanitarian crisis in Ethiopia's northern Tigray region for the first time since conflict erupted there five months ago, calling for reported atrocities to be investigated.

headline: US looking into reports of Ethiopian military executing unarmed men after CNN investigation
author: Ivana Kottasová, CNN
contributors: CNN's Bethlehem Feleke, Eliza Mackintosh, Gianluca Mezzofiore, Katie Polglase and Nima Elbagir contributed reporting.
intro: The US State Department said Monday it was looking into reports of extrajudicial executions committed by the Ethiopian army following a CNN investigation.

headline: 'Two bullets is enough'
author:
Bethlehem Feleke, Eliza Mackintosh, Gianluca Mezzofiore, Katie Polglase and Nima Elbagir
Video by Barbara Arvanitidis and Mark Baron, CNN
contributors:
CNN's Eliza Mackintosh wrote and reported from London. CNN's Bethlehem Feleke reported from Nairobi, Gianluca Mezzofiore, Katie Polglase reported from London, while Nima Elbagir reported from the Sudan-Ethiopia border. Mebrahtu Kindeya Hagos translated for CNN.

Design and visual editing by Muhammad Darwish, Natalie Croker, Henrik Pettersson and Sarah Tilotta.

headline: Ethiopia dismisses evidence of war crimes verified by CNN investigation
author: Bethlehem Feleke, Eliza Mackintosh, Gianluca Mezzofiore, Katie Polglase and Nima Elbagir, CNN
contributors: Video by Barbara Arvanitidis and Mark Baron. Emmet Lyons contributed to this report.
intro: Ethiopia's government said Friday that "social media posts and claims cannot be taken as evidence" after a CNN investigation found that Ethiopian soldiers executed unarmed men in the country's war-torn Tigray region.

headline: Ethiopian Prime Minister says Eritrea will withdraw troops from Tigray
author: Bethlehem Feleke and Eliza Mackintosh, CNN
contributors: CNN's Gianluca Mezzofiore, Katie Polglase, Nima Elbagir, Barbara Arvanitidis and Alex Platt contributed to this report
intro: Eritrea will withdraw its troops from Ethiopia, Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed said on Friday, days after acknowledging for the first time that Eritrean forces had entered Ethiopia's northern Tigray region during the country's five-month-old conflict.

headline: Ethiopian leader says troops who raped civilians in Tigray will be held to account after CNN investigation
author: Bethlehem Feleke, Eliza Mackintosh, Gianluca Mezzofiore, Katie Polglase, Nima Elbagir, Barbara Arvanitidis and Alex Platt, CNN
contributors: CNN's Schams Elwazer, Richard Roth, Sarah Dean and Angela Dewan contributed to this report.
intro: Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed said Tuesday that his government would hold accountable any soldier found responsible for rape or looting in the country's conflict region of Tigray, just days after CNN and the UK's Channel 4 News published investigations into rape being used as a weapon of war against women.

headline: 'Practically this has been a genocide'
author: Bethlehem Feleke, Eliza Mackintosh, Gianluca Mezzofiore, Katie Polglase, Nima Elbagir, Barbara Arvanitidis and Alex Platt, CNN
contributors: CNN's Nima Elbagir and Barbara Arvanitidis reported from Hamdayet. Eliza Mackintosh wrote and reported from London. Bethlehem Feleke reported from Nairobi. Gianluca Mezzofiore and Katie Polglase reported from London.

headline: Massacre in the mountains
author:
Barbara Arvanitidis, Nima Elbagir, Bethlehem Feleke, Eliza Mackintosh, Gianluca Mezzofiore and Katie Polglase

Video by Mark Baron, Alex Platt, Elisa Solinas, Jessi Esparza and Agne Jurkenaite, CNN
contributors:
Eliza Mackintosh wrote and reported. Barbara Arvanitidis, Nima Elbagir, Bethlehem Feleke, Gianluca Mezzofiore and Katie Polglase reported.

Edited by Nick Thompson. Video and editorial supervised by Dan Wright. Design and visual editing by Peter Robertson, Henrik Pettersson, Brett Roegiers, Sarah Tilotta, Temujin Doran and Lauren Cook.

Jennifer Hansler contributed to this report from Washington, DC.

headline: Biden dispatches Democratic senator to Ethiopia amid Tigray crisis
author: Jennifer Hansler, CNN
intro: President Joe Biden is dispatching one of his top congressional allies to Ethiopia to meet with Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed amid the humanitarian crisis in that country's Tigray region.

headline: Blinken: Acts of 'ethnic cleansing' committed in Western Tigray
author: Jennifer Hansler, CNN
intro: Secretary of State Tony Blinken for the first time Wednesday used the term "ethnic cleansing" to describe human rights abuses he said have been carried out in the Western Tigray region of Ethiopia, calling the situation "unacceptable."

headline: UN rights chief says war crimes may have been committed in Ethiopia after CNN reveals Tigray massacre
author: Niamh Kennedy, CNN
intro: The UN's high commissioner for human rights has called for an independent investigation into human rights violations that may amount to war crimes in Ethiopia's Tigray region, days after CNN published an exclusive report about a massacre in a village there.

headline: UN Security Council to discuss Ethiopia conflict following CNN investigation into Tigray massacre
author: Laura Smith-Spark and Richard Roth, CNN
contributors: CNN's Barbara Arvanitidis, Nima Elbagir, Eliza Mackintosh, Bethlehem Feleke, Katie Polglase and Gianluca Mezzofiore contributed to this report.
intro: The UN Security Council will discuss the humanitarian situation in Ethiopia's Tigray region on Thursday behind closed doors, two UN diplomats have told CNN.

headline: CNN EXCLUSIVE: Leader of Tigray's forces accuses Ethiopian and Eritrean governments of genocide
author: Barbara Arvanitidis, Nima Elbagir and Eliza Mackintosh, CNN
contributors: CNN's Angela Dewan, Emmet Lyons, Bethlehem Feleke, Gianluca Mezzofiore and Katie Polglase contributed to this report.
intro: The ousted leader of Ethiopia's Tigray region has accused the federal government and its Eritrean allies of genocide and other crimes against humanity, calling on US President Joe Biden to dial up the pressure against "invader forces."

headline: US calls for withdrawal of Eritrean forces in Ethiopia following investigation into massacre
author: Aaron Pellish and Laura Smith-Spark, CNN
contributors: CNN's Barbara Arvanitidis, Nima Elbagir, Bethlehem Feleke, Eliza Mackintosh, Gianluca Mezzofiore and Katie Polglase contributed to this report.
intro: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken called Saturday for the withdrawal of Eritrean and Ethiopian regional forces from the Tigray region of Ethiopia, and an end to killings and human rights violations there.

headline: Ethiopian war criminals able to leave Italian embassy after nearly 30 years
author: Eoin McSweeney, CNN
intro: Two convicted Ethiopian war criminals are likely to finally leave the Italian embassy in the capital, Addis Ababa, after taking refuge there for almost 30 years.

headline: More than 100 people killed in dawn attack on Ethiopian village, rights group says
author: Story by Reuters
intro: Gunmen killed more than 100 people in a dawn attack in the western Benishangul-Gumuz region of Ethiopia on Wednesday, the human rights commission said, as residents described fleeing the latest deadly assault in an area bedeviled by ethnic violence.

headline: 'They left us for dead.' Tigray refugees tell of horrors after Ethiopian troops vowed they'd be safe
author: Nima Elbagir, Salah Nasir, Awad Ismael and Barbara Arvanitidis
editorial_source: Hamdayat, on the border between Sudan and Ethiopia (CNN)
intro: s limping as he crosses the border, his leg bandaged with dirty gauze.

headline: Forces from Ethiopia's Tigray region say Eritrean troops are part of the conflict and the war is far from over
author: Nima Elbagir, Barbara Arvanitidis and Eoin McSweeney, CNN
intro: An official from the Tigray People's Liberation Front (TPLF) has told CNN the war in Ethiopia is far from over and that Eritrean troops are part of the conflict.

headline: Capital of Ethiopia's Tigray region under control of Ethiopian forces, says PM after intense bombardment
author: Nima Elbagir, Bethlehem Feleke, Awad Ismael and Salah Nasir, CNN
intro: Ethiopian National Defense Forces (ENDF) have taken control of Mekelle, the capital of the country's Tigray region, according to a tweet from Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed.

headline: At least 600 civilians were killed in northern Ethiopia massacre, rights commission says
author: Eoin McSweeney, Bethlehem Feleke and Schams Elwazer, CNN
contributors: Solomon Abrha contributed to this report. Reuters contributed additional reporting.
intro: At least 600 civilians were killed during an attack in northern Ethiopia in early November because of their ethnicity, a state-appointed human rights commission said Tuesday.

headline: Ethiopia enters 'final phase' of operation in Tigray region, says Prime Minister
author: Bethlehem Feleke, CNN
intro: Ethiopia has entered the "final phase" of a "law enforcement" military operation in the northern restive region of Tigray after a 72-hour deadline to surrender expired, Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed tweeted in a statement on Thursday.

headline: These refugees fled a massacre in Ethiopia's Tigray region. They join tens of thousands making the journey to Sudan
author: Eoin McSweeney, CNN
contributors: Yidnek Lema and CNN's Bethlehem Feleke, David McKenzie and Brent Swails contributed to this report.
intro: Oyeb Bari was woken by the sounds of guns and live ammunition on the night of November 9. The 55-year-old mother of six wasn't immediately sure what was happening, but had heard about the unrest in her region.

headline: Ethiopian troops are advancing on Tigray's capital, says government spokesman
author: Bethlehem Feleke and Eoin McSweeney, CNN
intro: Ethiopian federal troops are closing in on Tigray's capital of Mekelle, Redwan Hussein, the government spokesperson for the state of emergency task force, told CNN on Wednesday.

headline: A full-scale humanitarian crisis is unfolding in Ethiopia, the UN says
author: Eoin McSweeney, CNN
contributors: CNN's Sharon Braithwaite contributed to this report.
intro: A full-scale humanitarian crisis is developing in the Horn of Africa as thousands of people flee ongoing violence in Ethiopia's Tigray region, the United Nations Refugee Agency (UNHCR) said Tuesday.

headline: Ethiopia says it has seized another Tigray town as conflict embroils Eritrea
author: Story by Reuters
intro: Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed's government said on Monday it had captured another town in the northern Tigray region after nearly two weeks of fighting in a conflict already spilling into Eritrea and destabilizing the wider Horn of Africa.

headline: Forces from Ethiopia's Tigray region bombed Eritrean capital, Tigray leader says
author: Reuters and Eoin McSweeney, CNN
intro: Rebellious forces from Ethiopia's Tigray region fired rockets at the airport in Eritrea's capital Asmara on Saturday evening, their leader said on Sunday, confirming earlier reports of a major escalation in a 12-day old conflict in Ethiopia.

headline: Two missiles target Ethiopian airports as Tigray conflict widens
author: Story by Reuters
intro: Two airports in Ethiopia's Amhara state which neighbors Tigray -- where federal troops are fighting local forces -- were targeted by rocket fire late on Friday, the government said, as an 11-day conflict widened.

headline: War crimes feared in Ethiopia's Tigray conflict
author: Story by Reuters
intro: Fighting between Ethiopian government forces and rebellious northern leaders could spiral out of control and war crimes may have been committed, the United Nations said on Friday, as repercussions spread around the volatile Horn of Africa.

headline: Thousands are fleeing into Sudan to escape deadly conflict in Ethiopia
author: Bethlehem Feleke and Eoin McSweeney, CNN
contributors: Zecharias Zelalem and CNN's Schams Elwazer, David McKenzie, Brent Swails and Richard Roth contributed to this report
intro: Thousands of Ethiopian civilians have fled into neighboring Sudan to escape escalating conflict in their country's northern region, with many more expected to follow, according to Sudanese officials and the United Nations (UN).

headline: Concern of outright war in Ethiopia grows as PM presses military offensive
author: Story by Reuters
intro: Ethiopia's prime minister stepped up a military offensive in the northern region of Tigray on Sunday with air strikes as part of what he called a "law enforcement operation," increasing fears of outright civil war in Africa's second-most populous country.

headline: Air strikes in Ethiopia's Tigray region will continue, PM says
author: Story by Reuters
intro: Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed vowed further air strikes after jets bombed the northern Tigray region on Friday amid reports that Tigrayan forces had seized control of federal military sites and weapons.

headline: Ethiopia Prime Minister says Tigray military ops 'limited' as Sudan closes border
author: Bethlehem Feleke and Eoin McSweeney, CNN
contributors: CNN's David McKenzie and Brent Swails contributed to this report.
intro: Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed said Friday that ongoing military operations in the country's north that have stoked fears of civil war "have clear, limited & achievable objectives."

headline: Why are there fears of civil war in Ethiopia?
author: Brent Swails and David McKenzie, CNN
intro: When Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed of Ethiopia received the Nobel Peace Prize last year, he was lauded as a regional peacemaker. Now, he is being asked to pull his own country back from the brink of civil war.

headline: Ethiopia's Nobel laureate leader vows 'military confrontation' with restive region
author: Eoin McSweeney and Bethlehem Feleke, CNN
intro: Ethiopia's Nobel Peace Prize-winning Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed has declared a state of emergency in the restive Tigray region in response to an alleged attack by the Tigray People's Liberation Front (TPLF) on a federal military base.
